Dear Ms. Prudhomme:
Attached is the Interim Inspection Report for the above referenced facility completed on
May 23 and May 25, 2022. Due to the violations of applicable licensing rules, sections of
the contract and Modified Implementation Sustainability and Exit Plan (MISEP)
requirements, a written corrective action plan is required. It should be noted that violations
of any licensing rules are also violations of the MISEP and your contract. The corrective
action plan is due 15 days from the date of this letter and must include the following:
 How compliance with each citation will be achieved.
 Who is directly responsible for implementing the corrective action for each
licensing statute and rule or section of the contract or MISEP citation.
 Specific time frames for each citation as to when the correction will be
completed or implemented.
 How continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is
achieved.
 The signature of the responsible party and a date.
If you fail to submit an acceptable corrective action plan, disciplinary action may result.
Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any
questions. In the event that I am not available, and you need to speak to someone
immediately, please contact the area manager at (616) 204-6992.
Sincerely,

III. DESCRIPTION OF FINDINGS
1.) The facility is in compliance with all applicable rules and statutes except for the
following:
R 400.4113 Employee records.
An institution shall maintain employee records for each
employee and shall include documentation of all of the
following information prior to employment or at the time
specified in this rule:
(e) Three dated references which are obtained prior to
employment from persons unrelated to the employee and
which are less than 12 months old.
Three of four new hire employee files reviewed had references that were completed
after the employee was hired.
2.) Any violation listed in section 1 is also an MISEP violation. Please note that there are
additional MISEP requirements that may not be included in section 1. The facility is in
compliance will all additional MISEP requirements.
3.) Any violation listed in section 1 is also a DHHS Contract/Policy violation. Please note
that there are additional DHHS Contract/Policy requirements that may not be included
in section 1. The facility is in compliance with all additional DHHS Contract/Policy
requirements.
IV. TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE
The facility did not require technical assistance.
V. CONSULTATION
The facility was not in need of consultation.
1

VI. EVALUATION OF RENEWAL PERIOD
There were no substantiated incidents of maltreatment in care during this
licensing period.
There have been five special investigations during this period under review. The
investigations involved allegations of improper restraints and the grievance procedure
not being followed. Three of the five investigations did not result in any rule
violations. Two of the five investigations are still pending investigation. The facility’s
corrective action plan compliance is monitored quarterly, and they not have any active
corrective action plans.
Chief Administrator Assessment
Gerber House has not had any youth placed since December 1, 2021, due to staffing
issues. The goal of the facility is to hire more staff and be able to place youth back
into Gerber House as staff are hired. The staff at Putnam House are seasoned staff
that have good leadership qualities that are able to mentor and coach the newer staff.
The management team has been providing a lot of education to staff regarding
licensing rules, policies and the “why” behind what Eagle Village does. The facility
has seen this as a positive tool for the staff. The Corrective Action Plan from the
renewal audit last year has been implemented and changes have been made as
needed.
Interviews
Youth reported in interviews feeling safe, understanding the rules of the house, and
spoke of a camping trip they had just participated in. Two youth described liking
where they lived and staff being strict but fair. One youth described being in an
improper restraint and staff making threats against him. These allegations were
investigated with no findings. Staff reported a lot of newer staff working at the facility
but feeling they are getting direction from the supervisor and upper management.
Staff did not have any concerns with their work environment.
VII. RECOMMENDATION
Based on inspection findings the facility is not in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules and/or MISEP requirements and/or contract/policy. Upon
receipt of an acceptable corrective action plan, it is recommended that the facility
continue on their regular license.
